From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To save the persisted commands in the configuration log to the CiscoÂ IOS secure file system, use the **archive log config persistent save** command in privileged EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: The following example saves the persisted commands in the archive log to the Cisco IOS secure file system:
Router# archive log config persistent save
ExtraInfo: If the router is in the persistent periodic mode, the persistent timer is restarted.

RelatedCmds.description: Enters configuration change logger configuration mode.
Enables the logging of configuration changes.
Enables the configuration logging persistent feature.
